text: The Sterling Warriors are the athletic teams that represent Sterling College in Sterling, Kansas. They are part of the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics (NAIA). They compete in the Kansas Collegiate Athletic Conference (KCAC). Men's Sports Women's Sports Baseball Basketball Cross Country Football Golf Soccer Track & Field Basketball Cross Country Soccer Softball Track & Field Volleyball ==Football== Football at Sterling finished the 2009 season with a fourth-place finish in the conference. They had a 6–4 record.KCAC Sports 2009 Football Results Chuck Lambert is the program's current head coach, succeeding his brother Andy, the new coach at Southern Nazarene, Okla.Sterling College Coach profiles Notable former athletes include actor Clarence Gilyard.Clarence Gilyard Biography – Yahoo! Movies During the 1905 season, the Coleman Company set up temporary gas-powered lighting for a night game against Fairmount College (now called Wichita State University). It was the first night football game played west of the Mississippi River. Fairmount won the game 24–0. ==References== Category:Sports
title: Sterling Warriors
